doc.after: Although often inconspicuous fungi occur in every environment on Earth and play very important roles in most ecosystems Along with bacteria fungi are the major decomposers in most terrestrial and some aquatic ecosystems and therefore play a critical role in biogeochemical cycles 139 and in many food webs As decomposers they play an essential role in nutrient cycling especially as saprotrophs and symbionts degrading organic matter to inorganic molecules which can then re enter anabolic metabolic pathways in plants or other organisms 140 141
